meanings.definition: A group or collection of objects or people.
meanings.sent1: The scogs of colorful toys filled the playroom.
meanings.sent2: She organized the scogs of books on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The scogs of mismatched socks seemed to have a party in the drawer.
meanings.sent4: The scogs of stars in the night sky twinkled brightly.
meanings.sent5: The scogs of seashells on the beach created a beautiful mosaic.

meanings.definition: To gather or assemble in a haphazard manner.
meanings.sent1: He would scogs his tools in a messy pile after working.
meanings.sent2: The children would scogs their toys together before bedtime.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally scogs her keys with her phone in the bag.
meanings.sent4: The wind scogs the fallen leaves into a swirling dance.
meanings.sent5: The chef would scogs various ingredients to create a new recipe.
